title: The Justice Department Will Investigate Epstein Ties. Just Not to Trump.
summary: President Trump ordered the Justice Department to investigate the dealings of Democrats with Jeffrey Epstein, after a week in which his own relationship with the convicted sex offender was in the spotlight.

title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging
summary: The Oval Office study has become a room for Trump merchandise.

title: Trump Pulls Nominee for Top I.R.S. Lawyer
summary: President Trump’s announcement came after the nominee, Donald L. Korb, came under fire from the far-right activist Laura Loomer on social media.

title: Indiana Senate Says It Won’t Vote on Redistricting That Trump Sought
summary: The pushback from Senate Republicans follows the governor’s call for a special session to consider a new congressional map that President Trump wanted.

title: Trump Administration Lifts Some Food Tariffs in Effort to Ease Prices
summary: It is walking back levies on imports including beef and coffee in what critics say is an admission that tariffs raised prices in the first place.

title: A Reopened Government Hasn’t Ended Delays to Economic Data
summary: Jobs and inflation data will be released late and with caveats, complicating the Federal Reserve’s interest rate deliberations.

title: A.I.G. Parts Ways With Incoming President Before He Assumes Role
summary: John Neal’s withdrawal from the insurer comes as the company grapples with another high-profile departure.

title: ICE Scouted Site to Hold Immigrant Detainees in New York City
summary: Federal officials explored the possibility of using a Coast Guard facility on Staten Island. The effort appears to be part of a plan to expand President Trump’s immigration crackdown.

title: Amid Trump’s Deportation Push, More Families Are Being Torn Apart
summary: Maribel Lopez was hastily deported to Guatemala despite a pending asylum appeal, leaving behind a toddler. Her case highlights a growing pattern of speedy deportations.

title: Trump Plan Could Limit Green Cards for Immigrants From Travel Ban Countries
summary: The policy change is a major expansion of the administration’s push to crack down on immigration from countries that it says lack sufficient screening and vetting abilities.

title: Boston University Student Attacked Online Over Claim He Called ICE on Workers
summary: The student, the president of the school’s College Republicans club, said he reported immigrant carwash workers. Now he is facing online attacks after nine of the workers were detained.

title: Olivia Nuzzi on the Scandal With RFK Jr. that Upended Her Career
summary: The former political journalist has written a combustive portrait of America, President Trump and the scandal with Robert F. Kennedy Jr. that upended her career.

title: Judge to Approve Purdue Pharma Bankruptcy, Releasing Billions for Opioid Plaintiffs
summary: Under the plan, the company will dissolve and its owners, members of the Sackler family, will pay as much as $7 billion of their personal fortune to states, localities, tribes and others harmed in the opioid crisis.

title: Southern California Storm Forecast to Bring Heavy Rain and Flood Risk
summary: An unusually powerful storm has prompted some evacuation orders before heavy rain on Saturday.

title: The Strategic Uncoupling of Zohran Mamdani and Brad Lander
summary: Mr. Lander, the New York City comptroller, campaigned with Mr. Mamdani and once hoped to join him in City Hall. Now he is eyeing a congressional seat.

title: Housing Official Who Attacked Democrats Invokes a Disputed Family Legacy
summary: The Trump nominee Bill Pulte has called out a Fed governor and New York’s attorney general for issues with their mortgage documents. Some leaders of the family’s home-building business bristle at how he has enhanced his reputation.

title: Seneca Soldier and Statesman Can Finally Add Lawyer to His Legacy
summary: Ely Samuel Parker, a Native American who served as an aide to Ulysses S. Grant during the Civil War, was kept from practicing law during his lifetime.

title: John Beam, Football Coach From Netflix’s ‘Last Chance U,’ Dies After Being Shot
summary: John Beam died after being shot at Laney College in Oakland, Calif., where he was athletic director. A man was charged in connection with the shooting.

title: Pioneering U.S. Street Photography, With Vienna in the Background
summary: Lisette Model’s candid and cruel portraits spawned an American genre. But the key to understanding her might lie in Europe, where she was born.

title: Trump’s Spending Abuses Are Out of Control. He Shouldn’t Have That Power in the First Place.
summary: Trump’s actions should alarm anybody who shares the American founders’ suspicion of centralized power.

title: ‘This Is the War Against Human Nature’
summary: Paul Kingsnorth argues technology is killing us - physically and spiritually.

title: Trump Orders Investigation Into Epstein’s Ties to Democrats
summary: Also, melting ice is a growing menace in the Himalayas. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: JPMorgan Had to Pay for Charlie Javice’s Legal Fees — and Her Restaurant Bills
summary: When prosecutors accused Charlie Javice of fraud, JPMorgan was forced to pay for her defense. The bank is not happy about her “shocking” spending.

title: Dog Accidentally Shoots and Injures a Pennsylvania Man, Police Say
summary: The man had been cleaning a shotgun and placed it on the bed shortly before it was fired. He received treatment at an area hospital.

title: Frank Chuman, Pioneering Lawyer for Japanese American Rights, Is Dead at 105
summary: He was sent to the Manzanar internment camp during World War II, an experience that inspired a long career in civil rights activism.

title: San Francisco Mayor Has First Major Error With Embarrassing Appointment
summary: Mayor Daniel Lurie has enjoyed strong approval ratings this year, but residents were dismayed after he appointed a city supervisor who quickly resigned after revelations emerged.
